messages.content:
Ticket #7823
Customer: rachel.thompson@meridian.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: URGENT - Our entire reporting suite is down. Every dashboard just shows "No data available". We're in the middle of month-end close and finance is losing it. Need this fixed NOW.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Complete reporting suite outage showing "No data available" during month-end close

Probable Cause: Snowflake warehouse REPORTS_WH may be suspended or ETL pipeline has failed upstream, leaving all mart tables empty or inaccessible.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Snowflake warehouse status for `REPORTS_WH` - verify it's not suspended or out of credits
2. Run `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh` to identify failed DAGs in the reporting pipeline
3. Check #data-platform-alerts for Snowflake connection or credential errors

Ticket #7901
Customer: miguel.santos@forwardretail.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: The inventory sync hasn't run in 3 days according to our ops team. We're showing stock we don't have and hiding stock we do. Already had two customer complaints about cancelled orders. This is costing us money every hour.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Inventory ETL pipeline stalled for 3 days causing stock discrepancies and order cancellations

Probable Cause: The inventory sync DAG has likely been failing silently or is stuck in a retry loop, possibly due to upstream API timeout or Snowflake load failure.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Airflow DAG `inventory_sync_hourly` in Astronomer UI for task failures over past 72 hours
2. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh inventory_mart` to verify last successful data load timestamp
3. Review #data-platform-alerts for any API rate limiting or connection timeout warnings

Ticket #8042
Customer: amanda.price@westbrook-financial.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Hi, we have a regulatory audit starting at 2pm today and our compliance dashboard is showing data from last week. The auditors specifically need yesterday's transaction records. Please treat this as highest priority.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Compliance dashboard stale by 7+ days ahead of regulatory audit at 14:00

Probable Cause: The compliance ETL DAG has failed or been paused, preventing daily transaction data from loading to the compliance mart in Snowflake.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Run `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh compliance_daily` to check DAG state and recent run history
2. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh compliance_mart` to confirm last successful load date
3. If DAG healthy, check Sigma dashboard cache settings and force refresh

Ticket #8156
Customer: tom.wright@pegasus-logistics.com
Plan: Personal
Issue: I can't export any data at all. Every export just spins forever then times out. I have a shipment manifest due to my biggest client in 90 minutes and I literally cannot get the data out of your system. Please help.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Data exports timing out, blocking time-critical client deliverable

Probable Cause: Snowflake ANALYTICS_WH may be overloaded or suspended, causing export queries to queue indefinitely and timeout.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Run `/scripts/snowflake/warehouse_utilization.sh ANALYTICS_WH` to check queue depth and running queries
2. Check Sigma for stuck or long-running export jobs under customer's account
3. Review #data-platform-alerts for warehouse suspension or credit exhaustion warnings

Ticket #8234
Customer: jennifer.okafor@bluestar.io
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: THIS IS THE THIRD TIME THIS WEEK. Dashboard data is wrong AGAIN. Our revenue figures are showing $0 for all regions since Tuesday. CEO just asked me why we apparently made no money this week. Fix this permanently or we're switching providers.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Revenue dashboard showing $0 across all regions since Tuesday - recurring failure

Probable Cause: Revenue ETL pipeline is failing repeatedly, likely due to an unresolved schema change or source data issue causing the aggregation to return nulls/zeros.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Airflow DAG `revenue_daily_agg` in Astronomer for failure pattern since Tuesday
2. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh revenue_mart` and inspect for NULL values in amount columns
3. Review DAG logs in Astronomer for schema mismatch or source API errors; check #data-platform-alerts for related incidents

Ticket #8301
Customer: kevin.zhao@quantumhealthcare.org
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Patient volume dashboard completely blank since this morning. We use this for ER staffing decisions. Without it we're flying blind on shift allocations. This is a patient safety issue for us.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Patient volume dashboard blank since morning, impacting critical ER staffing decisions

Probable Cause: Healthcare ETL pipeline or Snowflake connection failed overnight, leaving dashboard queries returning empty result sets.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Astronomer for failed tasks in healthcare-related DAGs since midnight
2. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh patient_volume_mart` to verify data freshness
3. Check Snowflake query history in Sigma for connection errors or permission issues on underlying tables

Ticket #8455
Customer: priya.mehta@luxebrands.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: We're getting duplicate rows everywhere in our sales data. The numbers are roughly 3x what they should be. Our CFO just presented completely wrong figures to investors. I cannot stress enough how serious this is.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Sales data showing ~3x inflation due to duplicate rows, incorrect figures presented to investors

Probable Cause: ETL deduplication step failed or DAG ran multiple times without idempotency checks, causing triplicate inserts into sales mart.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Airflow DAG `sales_etl_daily` run history in Astronomer for multiple executions or retries
2. Query Snowflake `SALES_WH` directly to check for duplicate primary keys in sales_mart
3. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh sales_mart` and review row counts vs expected baseline

Ticket #8512
Customer: daniel.murphy@castlegate.ie
Plan: Starter
Issue: look i know im on the free tier but my entire business runs on your weekly report and it hasnt generated since last monday. im a one person shop and this is killing me. orders are backing up because i cant see my pipeline

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Weekly report generation failed for 7+ days, blocking small business operations

Probable Cause: Weekly report DAG has been failing or skipped, possibly due to scheduler issues or upstream data dependency failure.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Run `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh weekly_report_gen` to check execution history and failure reason
2. Check Astronomer scheduler health and verify DAG is not paused or disabled
3. Review #data-platform-alerts for any batch job failures in the past week

Ticket #8678
Customer: lisa.andersson@nordictech.se
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Snowflake queries returning "warehouse unavailable" error. None of our analysts can run any reports. We have 15 people sitting idle and a product launch dashboard we needed live an hour ago.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Snowflake warehouse unavailable error blocking all analyst queries and product launch dashboard

Probable Cause: Snowflake warehouse has been suspended due to inactivity timeout, credit exhaustion, or manual suspension.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Run `/scripts/snowflake/warehouse_utilization.sh ANALYTICS_WH` to check warehouse state
2. Check Snowflake admin console for warehouse suspension reason and credit balance
3. Review #data-platform-alerts for auto-suspend triggers or account-level warnings

Ticket #8799
Customer: chris.bennett@alphaventures.vc
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Portfolio dashboard is showing yesterday's data as of 9am but it's now 4pm. We're in active due diligence on an acquisition and need real-time numbers. Our deal team is waiting on me. What's the ETA on a fix?

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Portfolio dashboard stale by 7+ hours during active M&A due diligence

Probable Cause: Intraday refresh DAG has stopped running or is stuck, possibly due to upstream API failures or Airflow worker issues.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Airflow DAG `portfolio_intraday_sync` in Astronomer for stuck or failed tasks since 09:00
2. Run `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh portfolio_intraday_sync` to get current state and last success time
3. Check #data-platform-alerts for Airflow worker health or external API timeout errors

Ticket #8834
Customer: nadia.volkov@streamline-mfg.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Production line KPIs dashboard down. Shows error: "Query execution failed". Our plant manager uses this for shift handovers every 8 hours. Next handover is in 45 mins and they're panicking. Manufacturing doesn't stop.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Production KPI dashboard failing with query execution error, 45 mins until critical shift handover

Probable Cause: Underlying Snowflake query is failing due to schema drift, missing table, or warehouse timeout on complex aggregation.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Sigma dashboard error logs for specific query failure message and query ID
2. Run `/scripts/snowflake/warehouse_utilization.sh REPORTS_WH` to check for resource contention
3. Query Snowflake QUERY_HISTORY for the failing query ID to identify root cause (missing object, timeout, etc.)

Ticket #8901
Customer: robert.hall@primerealty.com
Plan: Personal
Issue: Commission calculations are completely wrong in the dashboard. It's showing agents earned 10x their actual amounts. Payroll runs tomorrow morning and pulls from this data. If we overpay everyone by 10x we're done. Please call me if needed.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Commission calculations inflated 10x in dashboard, payroll dependent on data runs tomorrow

Probable Cause: ETL transformation logic error or decimal precision issue in commission calculation step, possibly from recent DAG code change.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Airflow DAG `commission_calc_daily` in Astronomer for recent code deployments or config changes
2. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh commission_mart` and manually verify sample calculations against source
3. Review DAG transformation SQL for decimal handling and aggregation logic errors

Ticket #7823
Customer: rachel.foster@meridian.co
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Our weekly report export is timing out. It used to complete in about 2 minutes but now it just spins for 10+ minutes then fails. We can still pull smaller date ranges manually but the full export doesn't work.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Weekly report export timing out after 10+ minutes

Probable Cause: REPORTS_WH may be undersized for the growing dataset, or a recent schema change increased query complexity.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Snowflake query history for timeout errors on export queries against `REPORTS_WH`
2. Run `/scripts/snowflake/warehouse_utilization.sh REPORTS_WH` to assess capacity vs demand
3. Review recent changes to report generation DAGs in Astronomer UI

Ticket #7901
Customer: marcus.okonkwo@bluebird.io
Plan: Personal
Issue: hey, some of my dashboard numbers look off? like yesterday's totals don't match what i exported last week for the same period. not urgent but kinda confusing

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Data discrepancy between dashboard and historical exports

Probable Cause: ETL backfill job may have reprocessed historical data with updated logic, or duplicate records were introduced during a failed retry.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh` to identify recent backfill operations
2. Compare row counts in Sigma for the affected date range across snapshots
3. Check `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh` for any failed-then-retried tasks in the pipeline

Ticket #8045
Customer: jennifer.hartley@novanexus.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: The filtering on our analytics dashboard is extremely laggy. Every time I change a filter dropdown it takes 20-30 seconds to respond. This started Monday morning. My team is losing productivity but we can still get work done if we're patient.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard filter interactions experiencing 20-30s latency since Monday

Probable Cause: Filter queries hitting unoptimised table scans after weekend ETL changes, or ANALYTICS_WH concurrency limits causing query queuing.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Sigma query logs for filter-related queries with high execution times
2. Run `/scripts/snowflake/warehouse_utilization.sh ANALYTICS_WH` to check for queuing
3. Review Monday's ETL deployments in Astronomer for schema or clustering key changes

Ticket #8112
Customer: andy.brooks@smallbiz.net
Plan: Starter
Issue: I've noticed my data seems to be about 6 hours behind. The dashboard says last updated at 2pm but it's 8pm now. Is this normal? I thought it updated more frequently.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard data showing 6-hour lag instead of expected refresh cadence

Probable Cause: Incremental ETL DAG may be stuck or failing silently on recent runs, causing refresh delays.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check `incremental_refresh` DAG status in Astronomer UI for stuck or failed tasks
2. Run `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh incremental_refresh` to view recent run history
3. Verify Snowflake stream consumption in #data-platform-alerts for ingestion delays

Ticket #8267
Customer: priya.sharma@finservltd.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: We're seeing intermittent "query cancelled" errors when running our custom reports. Maybe 1 in 4 attempts fails. It's been happening since Thursday. We can retry and it usually works, but this is quite frustrating for my analysts.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Intermittent "query cancelled" errors on custom reports (~25% failure rate)

Probable Cause: Warehouse auto-suspend may be terminating long-running queries, or statement timeout thresholds were recently tightened.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Snowflake query history for cancelled queries and their durations on `REPORTS_WH`
2. Review warehouse auto-suspend and statement timeout settings in Snowflake console
3. Check #data-platform-alerts for any config changes pushed Thursday

Ticket #8334
Customer: tom.gallagher@constructco.ie
Plan: Personal
Issue: Right, so I'm trying to load the monthly summary page and it's taking ages. Like properly slow - over a minute sometimes. Other pages seem grand, just this one. Been like this a few days now.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Monthly summary page loading slowly (60+ seconds) while other pages unaffected

Probable Cause: Monthly aggregation query likely hitting a full table scan due to missing clustering or stale materialised view.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Identify the monthly summary query in Sigma and analyse its execution plan in Snowflake
2. Check if `monthly_aggregates` materialised view is current using `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh monthly_mart`
3. Review query profile for partition pruning issues in Snowflake console

Ticket #8421
Customer: lisa.wong@brightpath.edu
Plan: Starter
Issue: Hello, I hope this finds you well. I wanted to report that the CSV export feature seems to be producing incomplete files. The row counts don't match what I see on screen. I've tried three times with the same result. Thank you for looking into this.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: CSV exports producing incomplete files with missing rows

Probable Cause: Export job may be hitting memory limits or timeout thresholds, causing truncated output without proper error handling.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check export service logs in Astronomer for memory or timeout errors
2. Run `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh export_service` to identify failed or partial completions
3. Compare exported row counts against source query results in Sigma

Ticket #8502
Customer: daniel.reeves@quickship.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: EXTREMELY FRUSTRATED. The real-time metrics widget keeps showing "Data Unavailable" every few minutes then comes back. This has been happening all week. We rely on this for ops decisions. It's not completely broken but it's unreliable.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Real-time metrics widget intermittently showing "Data Unavailable"

Probable Cause: Streaming ingestion pipeline experiencing transient failures or Snowflake stream lag causing data gaps.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check `realtime_ingest` DAG in Astronomer for task failures or retries this week
2. Monitor Snowflake stream lag metrics in #data-platform-alerts
3. Review Sigma widget's error handling and timeout configuration for real-time queries

Ticket #8589
Customer: carla.mendes@retailmax.co
Plan: Personal
Issue: The comparison charts on my dashboard are showing weird gaps. Like some days just have no data points at all, but I know we had activity those days. It makes the trends look wrong.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard comparison charts displaying gaps for days with known activity

Probable Cause: ETL job may have skipped processing for certain dates due to source data delays or partition-level failures.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh daily_metrics` to identify missing date partitions
2. Check Airflow task logs in Astronomer for the affected date range
3. Query source tables directly in Sigma to confirm whether raw data exists for gap dates

Ticket #8677
Customer: hassan.ali@logisticspro.ae
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Our scheduled email reports have been arriving 3-4 hours late for the past week. They're supposed to land in inboxes by 7am but we're getting them at 10 or 11. The data in them looks correct, just very delayed.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Scheduled email reports arriving 3-4 hours late

Probable Cause: Report generation DAG is queued behind other jobs, or upstream dependencies are completing later than expected.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check `scheduled_reports` DAG execution times in Astronomer for the past week
2. Run `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh scheduled_reports` to identify dependency wait times
3. Review Airflow pool and slot allocation in #data-platform-alerts for resource contention

Ticket #8745
Customer: sophie.laurent@creativestudio.fr
Plan: Starter
Issue: hi there! just noticed something odd - when i drill down into the details view, some records show "null" for fields that definitely have values. if i export the same data to CSV the values are there. not blocking me but seems buggy?

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Detail view displaying null values for populated fields; CSV export shows correct data

Probable Cause: Dashboard query using a different view or transformation layer that has stale column mappings after a schema change.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Compare the detail view query against the export query in Sigma to identify transformation differences
2. Check recent schema migrations in `/scripts/etl/dag_status.sh schema_sync` for column changes
3. Verify view definitions in Snowflake match current source table schema

Ticket #8812
Customer: kevin.o'brien@mackenzie.ie
Plan: Personal
Issue: Sales figures on the dashboard seem to be double-counted sometimes. I cross-referenced with our internal records and the totals are inflated by roughly 15-20%. This is making our reporting inaccurate. We can work around it but need it fixed.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P2 (service degraded)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Sales dashboard showing inflated totals (~15-20% overcounting)

Probable Cause: ETL deduplication logic may have been affected by a recent pipeline change, or source system is sending duplicate events that aren't being filtered.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Run `/scripts/etl/check_snowflake_load.sh sales_mart` and check for duplicate transaction IDs
2. Review recent changes to `sales_etl_daily` DAG deduplication logic in Astronomer
3. Query raw vs transformed tables in Sigma to identify where duplicates are introduced

Ticket #9012
Customer: nina.petrov@designlab.co
Plan: Starter
Issue: Small thing - the chart colours on my dashboard changed recently? They used to be blue/green and now they're purple/orange. Just wondering if that was intentional.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard chart colour scheme changed unexpectedly

Probable Cause: Recent Sigma template or theme update may have altered default colour palettes for charts.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Review recent Sigma template deployments for colour scheme changes
2. Check if customer's dashboard is using default theme vs custom palette
3. Confirm whether this was an intentional design update and update release notes if so

Ticket #9134
Customer: ben.kowalski@freelancewriter.me
Plan: Personal
Issue: Hi! When I hover over data points in my line chart, the tooltip shows dates in MM/DD/YYYY format but I'm in Europe and would prefer DD/MM/YYYY. Is there a way to change this?

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard tooltips displaying US date format instead of regional format

Probable Cause: Sigma dashboard not respecting user locale settings for date formatting in tooltip components.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check user's locale settings in account preferences and verify Sigma is receiving them
2. Review Sigma tooltip configuration for date format handling
3. Log feature request if regional date formatting is not currently supported in tooltips

Ticket #9201
Customer: aisha.rahman@nonprofit.org
Plan: Starter
Issue: The download button on my reports page says "Export to CSV" but the file that downloads is actually called "export.csv.txt". It still works if I rename it, just a bit odd.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: CSV export files downloading with incorrect .csv.txt extension

Probable Cause: Content-Disposition header in export service may be misconfigured, appending .txt extension to filename.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check export service response headers for Content-Disposition formatting
2. Test export using `test-export@internal.io` account across different browsers
3. Review recent changes to export endpoint in the ETL service codebase

Ticket #9278
Customer: oliver.grant@hobbyshop.uk
Plan: Personal
Issue: Probably just me being thick, but where did the "Compare periods" toggle go? I swear it used to be in the top right corner of the dashboard. Did it move somewhere?

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Customer unable to locate "Compare periods" toggle on dashboard

Probable Cause: UI redesign may have relocated the comparison feature, or it was moved to a filter panel in recent Sigma update.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Review recent Sigma UI changes and confirm new location of comparison toggle
2. Check if feature visibility is tied to specific dashboard templates
3. Update user documentation and consider adding tooltip or onboarding hint for relocated features

Ticket #9345
Customer: grace.liu@consultingfirm.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: I noticed that when I print my dashboard to PDF, the footer shows "Page 1 of 1" even when the content spans multiple pages. Minor cosmetic issue but looks a bit unprofessional when sharing with clients.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: PDF export showing incorrect page count in footer

Probable Cause: Sigma PDF renderer not calculating total page count correctly, likely defaulting to 1.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Reproduce issue using `test-dashboard@internal.io` with multi-page content
2. Check Sigma PDF export configuration for pagination settings
3. Log bug with Sigma support if this is a vendor-side rendering issue

Ticket #9412
Customer: max.fernandez@solopreneur.co
Plan: Starter
Issue: Just curious - my dashboard shows data going back 12 months but I've been a customer for 18 months. Is older data archived somewhere or is 12 months the limit?

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Customer enquiring about historical data retention beyond 12 months

Probable Cause: Default dashboard view is configured to show trailing 12 months; older data likely exists in Snowflake but isn't surfaced in the UI.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Confirm data retention policy in Snowflake and check if customer's historical data exists
2. Review dashboard date range picker limits in Sigma configuration
3. Update knowledge base to clarify data retention and how to access older data if available

Ticket #9489
Customer: elena.vasquez@artisan.studio
Plan: Personal
Issue: There's a typo on the analytics page - it says "Tota Revenue" instead of "Total Revenue" in one of the card headers. Thought you'd want to know!

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Typo in dashboard card header - "Tota Revenue" instead of "Total Revenue"

Probable Cause: Simple typo in Sigma dashboard template or underlying label configuration.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Locate the affected card in Sigma dashboard editor and correct the label
2. Check if this label is defined in a shared template affecting multiple dashboards
3. Add dashboard text review to QA checklist for future deployments

Ticket #9556
Customer: ryan.murphy@tradeco.ie
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: The bar chart on our sales dashboard shows decimal places for whole numbers - like "£1,234.00" instead of just "£1,234". We'd prefer cleaner formatting if possible. No rush.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Currency values displaying unnecessary decimal places on bar chart

Probable Cause: Number formatting in Sigma chart configuration set to always show 2 decimal places regardless of value.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Review number format settings for affected charts in Sigma dashboard editor
2. Check if formatting is inherited from Snowflake column definitions in `SALES_WH`
3. Test conditional formatting to show decimals only when values are non-whole numbers

Ticket #9623
Customer: julia.andersson@nordicstartup.se
Plan: Starter
Issue: hello! i was wondering why the mobile view of my dashboard shows charts in a different order than on desktop? on desktop it's revenue then users, on mobile it's users then revenue. confusing but not a big deal

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard chart ordering differs between desktop and mobile views

Probable Cause: Sigma's responsive layout may be reordering components based on mobile grid constraints rather than preserving desktop order.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Test dashboard responsive behaviour in Sigma preview mode across screen sizes
2. Check if mobile layout has explicit ordering configuration separate from desktop
3. Document expected responsive behaviour and raise with Sigma if ordering consistency is a feature gap

Ticket #9701
Customer: charles.dubois@boutiquehotel.fr
Plan: Personal
Issue: When I use the date picker to select "Last 7 days", it seems to include today even though today isn't finished. Shouldn't it be the 7 complete days before today?

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: "Last 7 days" date filter includes incomplete current day

Probable Cause: Date range logic uses inclusive current date. This may be intentional behaviour but customer expected trailing complete days only.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Confirm intended behaviour for "Last N days" filters in product documentation
2. Check if Sigma date picker has configuration for inclusive vs exclusive current day
3. If by design, update tooltip or help text to clarify filter behaviour

Ticket #9778
Customer: amara.johnson@creativeco.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: Minor thing - the loading spinner on the dashboard is a bit... aggressive? It's very large and bright and makes me think something is wrong even when it's just loading normally. Could it be more subtle?

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard loading spinner perceived as too prominent

Probable Cause: Loading indicator styling is intentionally visible but may be oversized for some users' preferences; this is a UX feedback item.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Review loading spinner CSS in dashboard template for size and colour values
2. Gather additional user feedback on loading indicator UX
3. Log as UX improvement request for next design review cycle

Ticket #9845
Customer: thomas.weber@smallbiz.de
Plan: Starter
Issue: I tried to bookmark a filtered view of my dashboard but when I open the bookmark, the filters reset to defaults. Would be nice if filters were saved in the URL. Just a suggestion!

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P3 (non-blocking)

Owner: Data Platform Team

Summary: Dashboard filter state not persisted in URL for bookmarking

Probable Cause: Sigma dashboard may not be configured to serialise filter parameters into URL query strings.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check Sigma dashboard settings for URL parameter persistence options
2. Test whether filter state can be encoded in URL using Sigma's embedding features
3. Log as feature request if URL filter persistence is not currently supported

Ticket #7812
Customer: michael.oconnor@finserve.co.uk
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: URGENT - Our entire sales floor (50+ people) cannot log in. Getting 401 errors on every attempt. We're losing deals right now. Need this fixed immediately.

## Internal Bug Report

Severity: P1 (business-critical)

Owner: Auth Team

Summary: Organisation-wide login failure with 401 errors affecting 50+ users

Probable Cause: Auth-service may be returning invalid tokens, or API gateway rejecting valid credentials due to misconfigured authentication middleware.

Suggested Investigation:
1. Check `auth-service` pods in ArgoCD for restarts or failed deployments
2. Run `/scripts/auth/token_debug.sh finserve_org_id` to trace token generation flow
3. Review Datadog APM for 401 spike patterns on `/auth/login` endpoint

Ticket #8934
Customer: priya.sharma@retailmax.com
Plan: Enterprise
Issue: We switched to Azure AD SSO last week and it was working fine until this morning. Now nobody can authenticate through SSO. Our Black Friday prep team is completely blocked.

## Internal Bug Report
